Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: taste; hence: = a pattern of behavior, as observed by others
= name or title of man; probably another name for Achish (אָכִישׁ) ► king of Gath (גַּת) or his title
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: at all time; = a long stretch of time, without any interruptions
= action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans express their pride and satisfaction about themselves, their actions, certain circumstances they find themselves in, or a deity that they consider responsible for those circumstances

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= action by which humans proclaim the greatness of a deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which humans acknowledge the elevated status of deities and give expression to that
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= state in which humans experience a strong fear that certain things might happen to them
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

Node.gloss: to set up (a tent)|to erect (a tent)|to encamp
Node.definition: = action by which an individual or group of people settles in a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans experience fear
= causative action by which deities bring humans out of a dangerous situation
= process by which the flavor of something is perceived with one's mind/soul

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: set apart; hence: = human being in the service of God and therefore set apart from other people

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state in which humans experience fear
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
= state in which an animal lacks what is essential for its normal needs
= to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to lack|to be in need (of something)
Node.definition: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to see good; hence: = state in which humans experience well being
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= causative action by which humans keep part of their body from engaging in a certain activity
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans experience the desire to attain a certain status or condition and do what is needed to make this a reality

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
literally: to cut off (an event); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to stop happening

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: crushed; hence: = state in which someone has suffered harm and humiliation, ◄ as if crushed with a heavy object
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to bear one's guilt|to be punished
Node.definition: = to bear the consequences for an unlawful deed for which one is held responsible
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

Node.gloss: to bear one's guilt|to be punished
Node.definition: = to bear the consequences for an unlawful deed for which one is held responsible
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
